itemDescription: French educator, translator, and children's book author

wikipedia_page.main: Marie Charlotte Elisabeth Butts (Thonon, France 1870 – Geneva, Switzerland 1953) was a French educator, translator, and children’s book author. She served as the first General Secretary of the International Bureau of Education (IBE) from 1926-1953, alongside directors Pierre Bovet and Jean Piaget, respectively.

response: *Rabelais pour la jeunesse, Gargantua, texte adapté par Marie Butts, Librairie Larousse
*Rabelais pour la jeunesse, Pantagruel, texte adapté par Marie Butts, Librairie Larousse
* Marie Butts (1870–1953), French educator, translator, and children's book author; first General Secretary of the International Bureau of Education (1926–1953)
